subject: Psychology
title: Universal Facial Expressions
description: A short lesson to help you apply Universal Facial Expressions.

hook.text: A person in a remote Papua New Guinea village makes the same fear face as a New Yorker. Why?

buildup.text: Paul Ekman traveled the world showing faces to isolated tribes. They all recognized the same expressions.

discovery.text: He identified six universal expressions: happiness, sadness, anger, fear, surprise, and disgust.

twist.text: Recent research argues expression isn't as universal as Ekman claimed. Culture shapes how we show emotion.

climax.text: The truth may be in the middle: basic emotions are universal, but display rules are culturally learned.

punchline.text: Faces speak a shared language ‚Äî with local accents.

quiz.question: How many universal facial expressions did Ekman identify?
